item.title: Dumped Flood warning sign, 1st September
item.description:
"Flood" warning sign, dumped / abandoned on pavement along A40 Lansdown Road, outside Glencairn Court (GL51 6QN). No flooding at this location, so assume sign has been dumped, or has literally fallen off the back of a passing lorry. Needs to be removed (been there weeks).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Glencairn Court Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 400mm deep pothole in carriageway, 30th August
item.description:
There is a very deep pothole on the western side of the railway bridge at Claydon Lane, Homedowns, Tewkesbury. The opening is only about 100m across, but underneath is a very large void some 300-400mm across. This is in iminent danger of collapse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Claydon Lane, Homedowns
Report on FixMyStreet
